FeedItems.Title: Requiring two-factor authentication on NuGet.org
FeedItems.Summary:
NuGet.org will begin requiring two-factor authentication for accounts starting March 8th.
The post Requiring two-factor authentication on NuGet.org appeared first on The NuGet Blog.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Multiple certificates in your server nodes, one untrusted?" (#9115) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Hello,

First of all, love nuget. 
Second, 

I'm having trouble accessing nuget via Visual Studio (and also via Chrome). 
Sometimes it works, sometimes it doesn't.

Is it possible you have two (multiple) server nodes, where one is using server certificate which is created by untrusted signer?
Whenever I get response from server, where certificate path is "*.nuget.org -> Microsoft Azure TLS Issuing CA 05 -> DigiCert Global Root G2", everything is working just fine, but if I get response from other server, I get "Untrusted issuer error".

Seems like you've replaced certificates on 27.4.2022, maybe you forgot to do it on one of the nodes?

Or maybe there is problem with my organization's network or local machine ...

Best regards,
Matt

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[A11y][FastPass]Ensures ARIA attributes are allowed for an element's role" (#9114) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
URL: https://www.nuget.org/users/account/SignUp

Snippet
```
<label class="required" for="Register_Username" id="username-label" aria-required="true">Username</label>
```

Fix
ARIA attribute is not allowed: aria-required="true"

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Create artifacts for sharing NuGetGallery.Services" (#8962) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
I did a feasibility spike on getting this project's artifacts into a nupkg for broader use, and got it working using a nupkg stub workaround with built assets (the same approach used for the jobs projects in the same buildstep).

Note that using the `New-ProjectPackage` PS function for this was a dead end, as this project is not SDK-style (the projects in the repo that do use this function are all SDK-style). The msbuild error there is that the `pack` target is not defined, and this target comes built in to SDK-style projects. Converting the Services project into an SDK-style project is also non-trivial as it turns out, so that can possibly be future work.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[WIKI TYPO] Typo in "Branding the NuGet Gallery"" (#9113) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,

There is a typo in the "Branding the NuGet Gallery" wiki.

In the [Clone The Gallery](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/wiki/Branding-the-NuGet-Gallery#clone-the-gallery) section in point 3 you are missing a "h" in the URL, the URL is https://gitub.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery.git but should be https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery.git

Cheers

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[WIKI TYPO] Typo in "Branding the NuGet Gallery"" (#9113) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,

There is a typo in the "Branding the NuGet Gallery" wiki.

In the [Clone The Gallery](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/wiki/Branding-the-NuGet-Gallery#clone-the-gallery) section in point 3 you are missing a "h" in the URL, the URL is https://gitub.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery.git but should be https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery.git

Cheers

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Default into 2FA upon new user sign up" (#6858) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Once a new user sign's up using MSA, 2FA should be enabled. Users can disable if they wanted to.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: Many SPDX license Expressions not resolved by https://licenses.nuget.org/ instead "We have no information regarding the 'Xyz' license."" (#9097) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe, Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

dotnet 

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

1. create a Visual Studio Project Nuget Package with an SPDX Expression e.g. <PackageLicenseExpression>Hippocratic-2.1</PackageLicenseExpression>
2. build, pack and push the Package using an Azure pipeline 
3. Visit the Package Feed / Artifact Page in Azure 
4. Search for the new Package 
5. Click the Project License Link in the bottom right Corner which links to https://licenses.nuget.org/Hippocratic-2.1 
6. Get an Error Message: We have no information regarding the 'Hippocratic-2.1' license. 

The https://spdx.org/licenses/ Page lists many licenses, 
but it seems only a few work, e.g. MIT, MIT-0, LGPL-2.0-only and MPL-1.0 

Many Licenses listed on https://spdx.org/licenses/  don't work and the link https://licenses.nuget.org/Hippocratic-2.1 displays a page with an error message reading "We have no information regarding the 'Hippocratic-2.1' license."

I understand that maintaining the full List is a lot of work, but it would be good to at least 
* include a Link to the SPDX License https://spdx.org/licenses/Hippocratic-2.1.html 
* or a Link the List https://spdx.org/licenses/ 
in the Message when it cannot be found on https://licenses.nuget.org  

Best Regards...

### Verbose Logs

```shell
https://licenses.nuget.org/Hippocratic-2.1 does not link to or mirror 
https://spdx.org/licenses/Hippocratic-2.1
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[README] "Blockquotes" is using a larger font size, and the distance between rows is too large" (#8505) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Repro: Test package: https://int.nugettest.org/packages/license-expression-test2 Add this blockquotes into a readme file: ``` line 1 line 2 line 3 > quote1 >> quote 2 >>> quote 3 > quote 4 line 4 line 5 ``` The package detail page shows: Could the rendering be better?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: NuGet should show in the Task Status Center instead of the status bar" (#11814) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Other/NA

### Product Version

Visual Studio 2022 Version 17.3.0 Preview 2.0 [32509.446.main]

### Worked before?

No

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

Open a solution in Visual Studio.

Expected result:

NuGet restore progress shows in the Task Status Center.

Actual result:

NuGet restore progress does not show.
NuGet logs verbose messages to the status bar, which is not intended for showing the progress of background operations.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Requiring two-factor authentication on NuGet.org" (#61) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody: We announced plans to require tFA on all accounts on NuGet.org. Details in the [blog post](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/requiring-two-factor-authentication-on-nuget-org/).
